page.title: 06ST RAPHAEL'S, KINGSTON
page.content: This Roman Catholic Church was built by{Alexander Raphael}in 1846. He was a{Member of Parliament}for the Surbiton Park Estate. The building is of an ornate Italian style and its grounds are used for fairs. Members of the{French Royal Family}were married in this church. In 1895 the { {Prince of Wales,}later{King Edward VII attended a wedding there. There is a story that tells of how a fortune teller told Alexander that he would die two months after the Church was consecrated. He managed to put off this event three times but two months after the eventual consecration Alexander did die!
